title: Online dating apps: The worst Tinder pick-up lines revealed
text:
World famous Instagram account Tinder Nightmares shares hilarious exchanges from the online dating app - including cringe-worthy pick-up lines that should be avoided at all costs.

The popular page, which has 2.1 million followers, sheds light on the bizarre world of modern dating, where X-rated introductions and inane requests are the norm.

While many of the messages simply fell flat, some were outright offensive and instantly turned the recipient off, like one man who asked a woman if she liked to eat toenails.

Others started the conversation by bluntly asking for graphic sexual favours, and help 'getting even' with cheating partners.

World famous Instagram account Tinder Nightmares shares hilarious exchanges from the online dating app, like this man who told a woman she should take being called 'trashy' as a compliment

Others started the conversation by asking for sex, like this man who wanted to get revenge on his cheating partner

A significant number of Tinder users introduced themselves by bluntly asking for sex, like this man who didn't see the point of beating around the bush

Another man tried his luck by referencing the biggest clothing sale of the year in a sexual innuendo

Many of the messages were downright bizarre, including this exchange where a man wondered if his crush shared his love of eating toenails

Others were an instant turn off, like this matter of fact user who said he would drink a woman's bath water after she washed herself in it

Another overly eager Tinder user failed to spark a conversation, but continued the discussion with himself regardless
description: World famous Instagram account Tinder Nightmares shares cringe-worthy exchanges from the online dating app - and many of them can be used as a guide on how NOT to speak to women.
authors: Alice Murphy For Daily Mail Australia
